title: 467 - Joint press release from the Minister for Europe and foreign affairs and Minister for the Economy and Finance
text:
MINISTERE DE L’EUROPE 
ET DES AFFAIRES ETRANGERES 
 
MINISTERE DE L’ECONOMIE 
ET DES FINANCES 
 
 
 
 
 
Paris, 1 May 2018 
N° 467 
 
 
Joint press release from the Minister for Europe and foreign 
affairs and Minister for the Economy and Finance 
 
The French government takes note of the decision announced by the American authorities 
concerning the renewed 1 month temporary exemption from aluminium and steel tariffs on 
the EU.  We support the positions expressed by the European Commission. 
  
France will continue to advocate that the EU should be granted a full, permanent and 
unconditional exemption. There are no reasons which can justify that the EU be subject to 
a unilateral increase in tariffs on steel and aluminium. France and the European Union are 
allies of the USA. We are not at the source of the global overcapacity in aluminium and 
steel and we fully respect all WTO rules.  
The EU must continue to stand together united as it has done so in recent weeks.  
We agree that there is a problem of overcapacity in steel and aluminium. We are ready to 
work with the USA and other partners to deal with those issues, and to develop fast and 
appropriate solutions. But we can only do so serenely when we are certain that we will be 
excluded from a unilateral increase in tariffs on a permanent basis.
